comment: * Describes a metadata object of a {@link SignalingDataResponse}.

variables.name: LLS_NO_GROUP_ID
variables.comment:
* This value for {@link #getGroup()} denotes that there's no group associated with this
     * metadata.

variables.name: CONTENT_ENCODING_UTF_8
variables.comment: * The encoding of the content is UTF-8. This is the default value.

variables.name: CONTENT_ENCODING_BASE64
variables.comment: *  A/344:2023-5 9.2.10 compliant string for when the encoding of the content is Base64.

methods.name: public String getTable()
methods.comment:
* The signaling table data, represented as a XML, JSON or BASE64 string. * *

For more details on how this data is formatted refer to the ATSC standard * A/344:2023-5 9.2.10 - Query Signaling Data API. * * @return The signaling table data.

methods.name: public String getSignalingDataType()
methods.comment:
* Gets the signaling data type contained in this metadata object. This may be either a * LLS Metadata Object or a SLS Metadata Object name. * *

For more details on each type of metadata that can be requested, refer to the ATSC * standard A/344:2023-5 9.2.10 - Query Signaling Data API. * * @return the type of metadata in this metadata object

methods.name: public int getVersion()
methods.comment:
* Gets the version of the signalling element. For LLS, this should be the
     * LLS_table_version. For SLS Metadata Objects, this should be metadataEnvelope@version.
     *
     * For more details on where this version comes from, refer to the ATSC 3.0
     * standard A/344:2023-5 9.2.10 - Query Signaling Data API.
     *
     * @return The version of the signalling element.

methods.name: public int getGroup()
methods.comment:
* Gets the LLS group ID. Required for LLS Tables. For SLS Metadata Objects, this should be
     * {@link #LLS_NO_GROUP_ID}.
     *
     * @return the LLS group ID.

methods.name: public String getEncoding()
methods.comment:
* The content encoding of the data. This value defaults to {@link #CONTENT_ENCODING_UTF_8}. * *

Can be either {@link #CONTENT_ENCODING_BASE64} or {@link #CONTENT_ENCODING_UTF_8}. * @return The content encoding of the data.

methods.name: public void writeToParcel(@NonNull android.os.Parcel dest, int flags)

methodNames: public void writeToParcel(@NonNull android.os.Parcel dest, int flags)
